oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Fairs; Railroads; Forge shops; Foundries; Metallurgical industry; Smelters
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph showing the outdoor display of the Nashville, Chattanooga and St. Louis Railway at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition. Pictured are representations of pioneer chimneys and ore smelters.

This display was located near the Terminal Building and the Agricultural Building. The display attempted too show the early iron ore industry, as well as representations of pioneer times in Tennessee.
